Description: Fragment from the body of a vessel: of opaque yellow glass, glossy surface. Prefabricated 'eyes' of opaque dark blue, containing immediately within the circumference a single opaque white thread, were impressed into the outer surface at irregular intervals. Light-tan core.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (fig.32, p.33)
